init.description: Website for law firms, showcasing their services and information about the company.

video.title: Video
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about Libertas and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The Libertas website is a landing page for a law firm that displays its mission and values, services, and contact information‚Äîeverything needed to introduce the firm to the digital world and attract clients. The site also offers a search system, which makes it easy for users to navigate and find specific information. With a modern and responsive design, Libertas provides a pleasant and efficient user experience, helping the firm stand out in the market and attract new clients.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process for Libertas began with extensive research on landing pages related to law firms. I searched on Behance, Dribble, and Pinterest, seeking references and inspiration to create the best possible project.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research was a fundamental part of the design process for Libertas. Identifying the target audience and their needs was essential to create a site that met user expectations. Since it was related to a law firm, I aimed for a design that conveyed a higher level of seriousness and formality.

goals.goal1: Understand how users track cryptocurrency prices and make investment decisions
goals.goal2: Identify pain points and challenges in the current process of tracking cryptocurrencies
goals.goal3: Gather insights on user preferences and needs for a cryptocurrency monitoring app

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: Dealing with more institutional sites is always a challenge because it is necessary to convey the seriousness and trust that the company wishes to communicate. Libertas was designed to solve these problems, offering a modern and responsive design with intuitive navigation and well-organized content. With an elegant layout and efficient functionality, the site helps the firm stand out in the market and attract new clients, providing a pleasant and efficient user experience.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: Libertas was a project that filled me with pride. The first truly By myself project I produced is always special. I learned a lot about both the backend and the frontend. Implementing the navigation and especially styling the main background with Figma were personal challenges. Additionally, it was my first contact with the well-known Shadcn library, which certainly added a lot to my skill set. In the end, the result was a site that met the client's expectations and helped me grow as a developer.

init.description: Modern e-commerce model with a responsive layout and intuitive navigation, ideal for online fashion stores.

video.title: Video
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about the e-commerce site model and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The e-commerce site model is designed to provide a modern and responsive platform for online fashion stores. With an elegant design and intuitive navigation, the model makes it easy for users to browse products and make purchases.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process for the e-commerce site model began with an analysis of online store designs on YouTube and Behance. The final result is an e-commerce site model with a modern design and intuitive functionality, providing a pleasant and efficient shopping experience.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research for the e-commerce site model involved interviews and surveys with fashion store owners and consumers. We identified the main needs and challenges users face when browsing and shopping online. Based on these insights, we developed personas and user stories to guide the design process, ensuring the model met users' expectations and needs.

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: E-commerce Store was my first experience with React, and with it came the challenge of dealing with context and shopping cart logic. Additionally, styling the site was a personal challenge because I believe aesthetics are one of the most important aspects of a sales site. The e-commerce site model was designed to address these issues, offering a modern and responsive design with intuitive navigation and well-organized content. With an elegant layout and efficient functionality, the model helps fashion stores provide a pleasant and efficient shopping experience for their customers.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: I am quite satisfied with the result of this project. For a start, I am pleased with how it was done and the final delivery. I have some criticisms about the design of the product table, which was added later, but I believe the final result was quite satisfactory. I believe the e-commerce site model has the potential to help fashion stores improve their customers' shopping experience.

init.description: Arkan Seguros website with a modern and responsive design, highlighting the company's values and mission to attract and retain customers.

video.title: Visual Tour
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about the Arkan Seguros website and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The Arkan Seguros website was developed to highlight the company's values and mission, offering a modern and responsive design. The site provides detailed information about the services offered by Arkan Seguros, helping to attract and retain customers. With intuitive navigation and well-organized content, the site makes it easy to access information and ensures a pleasant user experience.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process for the Arkan Seguros website began with an analysis of customer needs and best design practices for corporate websites. We created prototypes to visualize the site's layout and functionality, incorporating user feedback to refine the design. The final result is a modern and responsive website that highlights Arkan Seguros' values and mission, providing a pleasant and efficient user experience.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research was conducted through meetings with the client, studying their target audience and how we can reach them. From this, we developed personas and user stories to guide the design process, ensuring the site met users' expectations and needs. An important detail was the customer feedback and FAQ section in each service, which helped us better understand what the client wanted.

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: Insurance companies need a website that highlights their values and mission, providing clear and accessible information about their services. Many corporate websites are complicated and difficult to navigate, which can drive away potential customers. The Arkan Seguros website was designed to address these issues, offering a modern and responsive design with intuitive navigation and well-organized content. Additionally, the challenge of building email delivery for the client was addressed, meaning that each form submission sends the client the request data, which was a personal challenge for me.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: The Arkan Seguros website has the potential to strengthen the company's online presence, highlighting their values and mission and providing a pleasant and efficient user experience. With a modern and responsive design, the site makes it easy to access information and helps attract and retain customers, increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty. The intuitive navigation and well-organized content ensure users can quickly find the information they need, improving the overall user experience and strengthening Arkan Seguros' image in the market.

init.description: Arkan Seguros dashboard with a modern and responsive design, presenting important charts and information for the company.

video.title: Video
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about the Arkan Seguros Dashboard and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The Arkan Seguros Dashboard was developed to provide a comprehensive and real-time view of the company's data, aiding in strategic decision-making. With a modern and responsive design, the dashboard presents important charts and information, allowing users to monitor site performance and identify trends and opportunities. The dashboard also offers advanced analysis tools, making data interpretation and strategic planning easier.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process for the Arkan Seguros Dashboard began with a detailed analysis of user needs and best design practices for corporate dashboards. From studies of PowerBi dashboards and others made with Pandas and Streamlit, we developed a modern and responsive dashboard that highlights important information clearly and accessibly, helping the company make informed decisions and improve its market performance.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research for the Arkan Seguros Dashboard involved interviews and surveys with company employees and managers. We gathered insights about users' needs and expectations for the dashboard, identifying the key metrics and information that should be highlighted. Based on these insights, we developed personas and user stories to guide the design process, ensuring the dashboard met the needs of its target audience.

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: The Arkan Dashboard was created to fill the gap in the lack of detailed customer data and information. Despite being exclusively from the site form, the client has full control and visibility over customer flow and trends, enabling better decision-making and insights for the company.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: Since this repository does not contain a backend, creating this dashboard was quite challenging, as data manipulation was done from a JSON file. The request for this dashboard came unexpectedly, so I had to change plans and build one using only Next's server-side, which was a very good and innovative experience for me. In addition, I had the opportunity to learn how to use Firebase, which will be very beneficial for future projects. Despite this setback, Arkan Seguros makes me very proud, a very well-structured and institutional site built with a lot of effort and dedication.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Onebitflix is a programming lesson website designed to provide a modern and accessible learning platform. With responsive design and intuitive navigation, Onebitflix makes it easy to access a wide range of programming courses, allowing users to learn at their own pace. The site includes a custom video player, support for multiple devices, and advanced course search and filtering features, ensuring a pleasant and efficient learning experience.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process for Onebitflix started with the idea of basing the design on Netflix, with a modern and responsive layout. Prototypes were developed to visualize the site's layout and functionality. The final result is a programming lesson website with an elegant design and intuitive functionality, providing a pleasant and efficient learning experience for users.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research for Onebitflix involved interviews and surveys with programming students and instructors. We gathered insights about users' needs and expectations for the platform, identifying key features and functionalities that should be highlighted. Based on these insights, we developed personas and user stories to guide the design process, ensuring the site met users' expectations and needs.

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: Online learning platforms face challenges in providing a pleasant and efficient learning experience for users. Many course sites have complicated layouts and limited functionalities, which can make accessing content and navigating courses difficult. Onebitflix was designed to solve these problems, offering a modern and responsive platform with navigation slides showing courses and advanced course search and filtering features, as well as favorite and liked features for greater student personalization. With an elegant design and integrated features, Onebitflix provides a pleasant and efficient learning experience for users.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: Onebitflix is a very robust and complete site model, with impeccable design and very comfortable and intuitive navigation. The site was a personal challenge for me as it was my first contact with React and Bootstrap, which taught me a lot about these technologies, as well as being the real 'robust' project. The final result is a site that met users' expectations and helped me grow as a developer. Onebitflix has the potential to transform the way people learn programming, offering a modern and accessible platform for learning programming.

init.description: Onebitflix API, with complete CRUD for categories and videos, as well as user authentication using JWT and bcrypt.

video.title: Video
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about the Onebitflix Backend and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The Onebitflix Backend was developed to provide a robust and secure API, supporting all the features of the programming lessons website. The API includes complete CRUD operations for categories and videos, allowing the creation, reading, updating, and deletion of data. Additionally, the API implements user authentication using JWT and bcrypt, ensuring the security and integrity of user data. With a scalable and efficient architecture, the Onebitflix Backend supports a wide range of functionalities and ensures the best possible user experience.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design process of the Onebitflix Backend started with a detailed analysis of the functional and security requirements for the API. We developed the API architecture and endpoints, ensuring that all CRUD operations were efficiently and securely supported. We implemented user authentication using JWT and bcrypt, ensuring the security of user data. Additionally, we designed the AdminJs page for better client administration with the application's content.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: User research for the Onebitflix Backend involved interviews and surveys with developers and platform users. We gathered insights into the users' needs and expectations regarding the API, identifying the main functionalities and security requirements that should be implemented. Based on these insights, we developed a robust and scalable architecture for the API, ensuring that all CRUD operations were efficiently and securely supported, meeting users' needs and ensuring the best possible user experience.

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: APIs for online learning platforms need to be secure and reliable, supporting a wide range of functionalities and ensuring the integrity of user data. Many course platform backends face challenges in implementing complete CRUD operations and secure authentication, which can compromise the user experience. The Onebitflix Backend was designed with Sequelize and PostgreSQL, providing an API with the necessary operations for its functioning. Additionally, it offers a complete and customized admin route for the client through AdminJs, giving full control over the application's content and facilitating the change or addition of new data.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: The Onebitflix Backend was the first backend I created, and it was indeed a huge challenge. I admit that when I finished, I didn't fully understand what I had done, but it was certainly the best possible starting point. I learned a lot about Node.js, Express, and Sequelize, and also gained practical experience with JWT and bcrypt. Additionally, the project includes integration with AdminJs, a content management system that makes life easier for the client, which greatly enhanced my learning experience.

The application also allows creating activities to be performed during the trip, as well as viewing and editing their details.

design-process.title: Design Process

background-research.title: Background Research

impact.subtitle: Impact

Completing the project in 3 days was a great challenge, teaching me a lot about organization and project planning, but I believe the main challenge was dividing the routes into use cases, creating repositories, and inverting the dependency.

init.description: A complete API for a gym pass system

video.title: Video
video.description: Watch the video below to learn more about the API-Gympass and its features.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: API-Gympass is a solution developed to manage gyms and check-ins in a gym pass system. The application includes features such as creating and validating check-ins, role-based access control (RBAC), JWT authentication, and support for Refresh Tokens. Additionally, the API performs proximity checks using latitude and longitude coordinates, ensuring that check-ins are only made when the user is near the gym. The application also includes unit and E2E tests with Vitest, ensuring code quality and security.

design-process.title: Design Process
design-process.description: The design of API-Gympass focused on building a modular and scalable architecture, following SOLID principles. The choice of technologies, such as Fastify for the server structure and Prisma for data modeling, was fundamental to ensuring performance and ease of maintenance.

background-research.title: Background Research
background-research.description: The user research for API-Gympass focused on understanding the needs of managing gyms and check-ins. We identified the importance of a system that ensured security and reliability, especially in the validation of location-based check-ins and user permission management.

goals.goal1: Develop a secure and efficient API for managing gyms and check-ins
goals.goal2: Implement a robust permissions system using RBAC
goals.goal3: Ensure data integrity with proximity checks and JWT authentication

problem-statement.title: Problem Statement
problem-statement.description: The main challenge of this project was implementing proximity checks for check-ins and ensuring that the JWT authentication system with Refresh Tokens was secure and efficient. Additionally, ensuring that the API was modular and easy to maintain was a priority throughout the development.

impact.subtitle: Impact
impact.title: Reflections and Results
impact.description: This project was an extremely enriching experience, particularly in terms of applying SOLID principles and creating unit and E2E tests with Vitest. The automation of the workflow with GitHub Actions significantly increased the efficiency and quality of development, providing a deeper understanding of the importance of CI/CD in software development.
